resources.string: Brahmleen Samarth Guru Dr. Chaturbhuj Sahay Ji Memorial Scholarships -

This scholarship is provided to those meritorious student who are involved in any kind of research relating to Yoga, Philosophy, Medicines or subjects related to Science, however, preferences would be given to those who are intending to do research on the spiritual methods of Ramashram Satsang Mathura propagated by Shri Guru Maharaj( Samarth Guru Dr. Chaturbhuj Sahay Ji). This scholarship would be maximum for three years duration.
Brahmleen Param Sant Shri Manmohan Lal Ji Memorial Scholarships –
This Scholarship is provided to the meritorious and poor students of Medicines, Engineering and students currently enrolled in the Indian Universities.
Brahmleen Param Sant Shri Mihilal Ji Memorial Scholarships –
This Scholarship is provided to the meritorious and poor students of Medicines, Engineering and students currently enrolled in the Indian Universities.
Brahmleen Param Sant Dr. Brijendra Kumar ji Memorial Scholarships –
This Scholarship is provided to the meritorious and poor students of Medicines students currently enrolled in the Indian Universities
Brahmleen Param Sant Hemendra Kumar Ji Memorial Scholarships –
This Scholarship is provided to the meritorious and poor students of Law students currently enrolled in the Indian Universities.
Brahmleen Param Sant Dr.Narendra Kumar Ji Memorial Scholarships –
This Scholarship is provided to the meritorious and poor students of Diploma or D.Pharma or BBA and B.Ed and is currently enrolled in the Indian Universities.
Smt. Vinod Kumari Ji Pujya Badi Bhabhi Maa Memorial Scholarships –
This Scholarship is provided to the meritorious and poor Girl student of Diploma or D.Pharma or BBA and B.Ed and is currently enrolled in the Indian Universities.
Junior Scholarships are provided to those meritorious and poor students who have passed class Tenth (10th Board Exam) and are currently in class 11th or in the class 12th of any recognized Board.
Navneet Hridya Param Sant Dr. Brijendra Kumar Ji
Param Pujya Smt. Vinod Kumari Ji

Saints transcends on this earth with a certain goal and object which is normally broader and grand than the object and goal of a common man and probably with this reason in behind, before his birth on 4 September, 1919, Mahatma Ji Maharj, our beloved Dada Guru (Mahtama Ramchandra Ji Maharaj, Fatehgah) said to Guru Maharaj( Samrth Guru Dr. Chaturbhuj Sahay Ji ) that an Auliya ( a saint of great order) is coming to your home in the form of your son: he will contribute to your auspicious mission . And in fact, in the later course of his life, everyone has seen him in the same form and spirit as had portrayed by Mahatmaji Maharaj before his birth. Reverend Bade Bhaiya (Dr. Brajemdra Kumar ji) as fondly called by his spiritual lovers in Ramashram Satsang Mathura.

Through-out his life he followed two basic principles of Gurumaharaj’s tenets i.e. unconditional love for all and service without pretence to the mankind. Born at Kosi in Distt Mathura, popularly known as Braj Pradesh, an ancient birth place of Lord Krishna. Dada Guru said to Gurumaharaj about him that “He is your spiritual offspring.”

After completing his primary education at Etah, where Gurumaharaj Ji lived prior to shifting to Mathura, Bade Bhaiya Ji went for his Medical studies and finally came in service as Doctor at Etah Jail.

His personality was of a great order and adorned with simplicity and humbleness made him incomparable. His heart always remained open to anyone who came seeking help not only in the field of spirituality but also his doors remained opened to everyone. His nature was kind, compassionate. Always stood to help and service satsangiees and general people. Whoever got privilege to come in touch with him forever loved and respected him. His behavior was an absolute ideal for any house holder.

His simplicity was his curtain, and barring only a few fortunate, who had acknowledged his spiritual summit, no one could ever uncover his greatness nevertheless his benevolence towards general and common people throw some light on his spiritual capabilities and power.
After retiring from service, he continued and contributed his services as doctor to general public at one hand and also headed Ramashram Satsang, Mathura.
Param Sant Dr. Brijendra Kumar Ji said –

“That the first and foremost important thing that seekers need for spiritual progress is faith. We must have faith in our Guide (Guru), and faith in his instructions. We must follow the spiritual practice (Sadhana) as instructed.The second important thing is service (Sevaa), service of the mission (Satsang family) and its members (Satsangee). An element of the service is to spread Guru’s mission but that does not imply that every mission worker becomes a teacher and starts teaching. For spiritual progress it is not at all required to become a teacher. Therefore, we shall faithfully continue the spiritual practice as instructed by the Guru. We will certainly receive Guru’s grace and God’s grace at appropriate time.”

Just two years before leaving this earth on July 30th 1985, he founded “Jia Maa Memorial Trust” from his own fund along with his wife Param Pujya Vinod Kumari ji (P.P. Badi Bhabhi ji, as fondly called in RSM) in the memory Param Sant Param Pujya Jia Maa (wife of Samarth Guru Dr. Chatarbhuj Sahai ji – founder Ramashram Satsang, Mathura)

It is said that great person never depart, they only permeate in all directions in the form of their life’s legacy. Their directions and unfinished work in the form of love and service to the mankind will always enthuse and illuminate millions of heart.

With the hope that the coming generation will follow the foot prints and directions of Guru Maharaj’s mission in future with dedication and devotion, he left this earth forever on 14 Feb. 1987, seeding passionate flames in us.
Samarth Guru Param Sant Dr. Chaturbhuj Sahai Ji
Mahatma Ramchandra ji Maharaj (Fatehgarh) Dada Guru Maharaj.

The thread of faith that holds Ramashram Satsang, Mathura (RSM) today started rolling in 1873, the year when Param Sant Sri Ramchandra Ji was born in the north Indian province of Manipuri. He studied English, Urdu, and Farsi and worked in a Government office in Distt. Farukhabad (U.P), India.

Though as a young man, Lalaji, as he was lovingly called, imbibed in him all the religious virtues from his mother, his spiritual journey didn\'t truly begin until he received spiritual initiation from a spiritually enlightened Sufi saint, a follower of Islam. Maulana Shah Fazal Ahmad Khan Sahib (Huzur Maharaj) would later on give Lalaji that moment in time in which he would touch the intangible and see the invisible. This great Sufi saint, Huzur Maharaj, took the revolutionary step of imparting the spiritual knowledge to a disciple who was not a follower of his own religion, thus exemplifying that Spirituality is above and beyond the barriers of religion, cast, and creed.

Though as a young man, Lalaji, as he was lovingly called, imbibed in him all the religious virtues from his mother, his spiritual journey didn\'t truly begin until he received spiritual initiation from a spiritually enlightened Sufi saint, a follower of Islam. Maulana Shah Fazal Ahmad Khan Sahib (Huzur Maharaj) would later on give Lalaji that moment in time in which he would touch the intangible and see the invisible. This great Sufi saint, Huzur Maharaj, took the revolutionary step of imparting the spiritual knowledge to a disciple who was not a follower of his own religion, thus exemplifying that Spirituality is…

Huzur Maharaj inculcated the “Ruhani Ilm” or what Hindus call “Brahm Vidya” or spiritual knowledge, in Lalaji at the age of 18. There were no scriptures read nor verbal instructions delivered. It was just the intimacy and regular contact between the Sufi saint and his disciple that the latter absorbed all the knowledge from his Savior, his Guru. Lalaji’s spiritual experiences seemed to be that of cosmic consciousness, an altered perception of the world he lived in. One day while he was walking down a small residential street with his Guru alongside, he experienced the Divine Vision. In a split of second, He visualized the whole universe dancing to a divine song, fully in rhythm. He also experienced a supernatural power in action in the entire universe. It was a blaze of illumination for a few moments. Following this experience, Lalaji made his primary mission to introduce the people with the true religion and connect them with God. He taught that Faith was the prerequisite of all devotion.

Samarth Guru Dr. Chaturbhuj Sahay Ji(Guru Maharaj) , personified the maxim, "The more spiritual a person is, the more he is human". In his daily life He was free from any kind of pose or pretensions. His heart was flowing with love and service for everyone. He always paid due attention to anyone who sought his help whether on spirituality or on any worldly affairs. He had all of the qualities of an ideal Guru and was habitually found in a meditative mood. Perhaps his greatest quality was that he never saw a difference between himself and others. He was not the least obsessed by notions of distinction that he himself was the Enlightened One, while others around him were languishing in the darkness of ignorance. His firmness of self-possession could not be shaken under any circumstances, and he was never perturbed. Tranquility was writ large on his face. He lived the life of a family man fully and unshakably, with a daily life marked with normalcy. He set an excellent example of how to combine spiritual idealism with domestic life. Serving his wife and children to the last, he mindfully attended to all domestic duties.

In 1930, Guru Maharaj, Samarth Guru Param Sant Dr. Chaturbhuj Sahay Ji, established Ramashram Satsang (Named it after his Guru, Lala Ji Maharaj, Mahatma Sri Ram Chandra Ji) at Etah (U.P) and later it was shifted at Mathura (U.P) , a northern Indian town . As per the directive of his Guru, he propagated a System of Meditation adaptable to the people irrespective of their religion, community or race. This system of meditation is especially suited for busy and demanding lives of today’s world. If we shape our lifestyles and mold our thought processes according to it, spiritual success and balance in life can be achieved effortlessly. We can learn to live a peaceful life amidst the stress.

This system of Sadhana (Spiritual Practices ) and Satsang (Spiritual Assemblies) is a unique unification of Karma (duty), Upasana (devotion), and Gyana (knowledge). The core of this unification is achieved through Dhyana (meditation) in every morning and in the evening for just 15–20 minutes.

Soon after founding Ramashram Satsang (now also Mathura) and also as per the wishes and the insistence from Mahatma ji Maharaj , the need for a monthly spiritual journal as well as spiritual literature was also felt and Hereinafter, the publication of a monthly journal “Sadhan" in Hindi (now also in English) began to publish from August of 1933. In addition, Sri Guru Maharaj started to work on Satsang literature. His numerous books, including a seven-volume book on his own spiritual experiences, have helped spiritual aspirants for decades.

As the decade of 1880–1890 arrived, a noble soul was born on November 3, 1883 in the north Indian province of Etah. He was none other than Paramsant Dr Chaturbhuj Sahay Ji, who would later become the founder of Ramashram Satsang Mathura. He studied Urdu, Farsi, English, Hindi, and Sanskrit. He had a degree in electro-homeopathy and also basic knowledge of Ayurveda that he genuinely used for selfless social service. He never spared himself in paying due attention to anyone who sought his help. He lived the life of a family man and believed that all prayers have one end—service of mankind. His advent was the golden era in the history of Ramashram Satsang Mathura(RSM).

Dr Chaturbhuj Sahay Ji, our Guru Maharaj, had the opportunity to spend some inexplicably special moments with Lalaji Maharaj (Dada Guru) in Fatehgarh, India during an epidemic outbreak. During these moments, this noble soul experienced an unknown dissemination of intrinsic power towards him whenever he was in the company of Dada Guru. Again there were no verbal lessons nor scriptures read; the knowledge just flowed in the right direction towards a well-chosen end point. The Guru-disciple tradition was reliving, yet again.
One day Dada Guru passed on the unique tool of Sadhana to our Guru Maharaj. Our system of meditation is based on what Guru Maharaj learned from Dada Guru that day.

In 1919, Paramsant Dr Sahay Ji received a directive from his Guru to contribute in the propagation of this system of meditation to the spiritual seekers. Guru Maharaj followed his master’s instructions in letter and spirit. Guru Maharaj, upholding the ethics of Guru-Shishya Parampara, brought the venerable tradition of his master\'s lineage to the people, giving the previously little known process of Sadhana, or meditation, to thousands of spiritual seekers. The Satsang spread at a fast pace and Guru Maharaj imparted the Anant Gyan (spiritual knowledge) and taught the Sadhana to all without any discrimination between the deserving and undeserving ones.
Paramsant Dr. Chaturbhuj Sahay Ji established Ramashram Satsang in 1930 at Etah, his birthplace in northern India.

Soon after the establishment of the Satsang, the need for a monthly journal and literature was felt. Hence, the publication of Hindi monthly journal Sadhan started in August of 1933. Sri Guru Maharaj started to work on Satsang literature; his numerous books have helped spiritual aspirants for decades, including a seven-volume book on his own spiritual experiences.

As per his Guru\'s directive, Sri Guru Maharaj gradually started teaching Sadhana over the traditional methods of attaining realization. Eventually, a system of meditation evolved which is a great gift to today’s busy individual. Practicing this Sadhana every morning and evening for only 10–15 minutes can provide results that may take many more years by other methods.

Param Pujya Jiya Ma had worked closely with Guru Maharaj every step of the way and not only took care of the household duties, but also quietly joined his work of teaching meditation and the practice of Sadhana through her presence during meditation sessions. Her amiable disposition also attracted innumerable spiritual practitioners to RSM. Pundit Mihilal Ji, who later contributed immensely to RSM met Guru Maharaj in 1931. Guru Maharaj prepared Punditji to join his spiritual work and look after the propagation of the Satsang.

Anyone can donate or contribute to Jia Maa Memorial Trust through Account Payee cheques / Drafts /multi city Cheques or through Online / NEFT/RTGS modes , but such donated amount should not be less than Rs.500/- . Receipts will be issued to the donors subject to realization of the amount.
For NEFT/RTGS/Online Payment modes following bank account No can be used
Kindly inform your transaction details to our office through email or message telephonically with your complete address.
Mobile no is: 8791487080 and email is:

All donations made to us is exempted vide order of commissioner of income Tax –I, Agra vide order letter No–CIT/Tech/Agra/80G–R/J8/2009–10/3288 dated 12/11/2009 under section 80 (G) of Income Tax Act 1961.
The next meeting of the trust will be held on 3rd September, 2018 at Tundla on the auspicious occasion of Tundla Bhandara of Ramashram Satsang Mathura.
Application forms can be had from the trust office free of cost by sending complete address through SMS on mobile no : (+91) 8791487080 or you can write to our office:
Incomplete forms will not be accepted, therefore make sure to complete your forms in all respect including all enclosures.
